title: Helicopter crashes in northern Indian state, 6 people on board
byline: A helicopter carrying six people crashed on Sunday in the northern Indian state of Uttarakhand, news agency ANI reported.

title: Huge fire breaks out at 67-storey building in Dubai, 3,800 people evacuated
byline: A massive fire broke out in a 67-storey building in Marina here, the Dubai Media Office (DMO) said on Saturday.

title: Giant squirrels, among animals doomed in farmlands in future: K.D. Lalkantha
byline: Agriculture Minister K.D. Lalkantha said  legal amendments will be introduced allowing farmers to dispose off some animals such as giant squirrels in their cultivated lands as an act of  pest control.

title: Missile attacks in Israel injure two Sri Lankan women
byline: Two Sri Lankan women were injured after Iranian ballistic missile attacks struck multiple locations across Israel, including Tel Aviv, Haifa and surrounding areas.

title: WTC final 2025 - Aus vs SA
byline: South Africa bag handsome 3,600,000 USD, Aussies take 2,160,000 USD.

title: SLAF deploys first Aeromedical Evacuation Team to UN Mission
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) deployed its first-ever Aeromedical Evacuation Team (AMET) to the United Nations Peacekeeping Mission in the Central African Republic on 14 June 2025.

title: No Australia or England for Sri Lanka in WTC 2025–27
byline: The ICC World Test Championship 2025–2027 will see 27 series and 71 matches in the league stage, with the top two teams in the points table qualifying for the final.

title: Gunmen open fire on house at Kohuwala
byline: Two unidentified individuals who arrived on a motorcycle opened fire at a house on Temple Road, Kalubowila, Kohuwala early this morning (15), before fleeing the scene.

title: President returns from Germany
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake returned to the island this morning (15) after concluding his official visit to the Federal Republic of Germany.

title: Sri Lanka’s foreign reserves overstated by USD 1.4 billion, Report reveals
byline: Sri Lanka’s official foreign reserves have been overstated by approximately USD 1.4 billion due to the inclusion of a currency swap from China that does not meet international standards, a new report published by FactCheck.lk said.

title: IMF’s Gita Gopinath arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Dr. Gita Gopinath, the First Deputy Managing Director (FDMD) of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), arrived in Sri Lanka this morning.

title: Dilantha Malagamuwa named Brand Ambassador of VIP travels
byline: Veteran international motor racing driver Dilantha Malagamuwa has been appointed as the brand ambassador of Negombo VIP Travels.

title: Vote on Colombo Mayor: Some members may change at last minute: SJB MP
byline: It is not possible to predict who will be elected as the Mayor of Colombo tomorrow because some members may change their stance at the last moment, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP S.M. Marikar said today.

title: Israel and Iran bombard each other as Trump says conflict can easily end
byline: Israel and Iran launched fresh attacks on each other overnight into Sunday, killing scores, as U.S. President Donald Trump said the conflict could be ended easily while warning Tehran not to strike any U.S. targets.

title: Two killed after bridge collapses in India
byline: At least two people have died after an iron bridge collapsed in western India, triggering a major rescue operation.

title: Sri Lankan woman, son arrested for murdering elderly woman in India
byline: A Sri Lankan Tamil woman and her son were arrested for murdering an elderly woman for gain at the latter’s house at Paramakudi, India on Friday, the Hindu reported.

title: 19-year-old dies in hotel lift collapse in Moratuwa
byline: The Moratuwa Police launched an investigation after a 19-year-old youth lost his life after an electric lift suddenly malfunctioned and collapsed at the Bolgoda Hotel in Moratuwa.

title: De Silva leads Sri Lanka Test squad against Bangladesh
byline: Sri Lanka’s cricket board Sunday named an 18-member squad led by Dhananjaya de Silva for the two-match home Test series against Bangladesh.
